snippet: As the deadline for a cease-fire backed by the United Nations passed in Syria on Thursday, experts and diplomats looked at other options and the role that Russia could play in them.
abstract: Diplomats and experts are looking at other options and the role Russia could play in them as the deadline for a cease-fire backed by the United Nations passes in Syria; failure of plan by Kofi Annan seems likely and it may persuade Russia and China not to wield their veto on Syrian resolutions, as they have twice previously; analysts say that China is basically following Russia's lead.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ellen Barry from Moscow, Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul, Steven Lee Myers from Washington, and Hala Droubi from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: As the deadline for a cease-fire backed by the United Nations passed in Syria on Thursday, experts and diplomats looked at other options and the role that Russia could play in them.

headline.seo: All Eyes on Russia as Syria Cease-Fire Deadline Passes
